messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] homemade Floam and Boomwhackers
messages.msgSnippet: Here is a link for the boomwhackers. There are different packages and accessories that go with them. I bought mine at a local music store. Basically, they are
messages.messageBody:
Here is a link for the boomwhackers. There are different packages and
accessories that go with them. I bought mine at a local music store.

Basically, they are tubes that you hit on any other object to make
music and sounds. They are supposed to be tuned to sound like musical
notes. I think you can even get sheet music to play songs.

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/B0002E2LTM/sr=1-5/qid=1137614123/ref=pd_bbs_5/102-6174380-6488120?%5Fencoding=UTF8&v=glance


I love sharing toys, resources, and ideas. We have been taking
glowstick baths and WOW! So magical (blue) and sometimes creepy
(red)...

Amy

messages.subject: homemade Floam and Boomwhackers
messages.msgSnippet: There is a recipe for homemade floam at http://www.beyondsatire.us/?q=node/82 We haven t tried to make it yet but we would like to soon! I have also seen
messages.messageBody:
There is a recipe for homemade floam at
http://www.beyondsatire.us/?q=node/82

We haven't tried to make it yet but we would like to soon!
I have also seen homemade floam listed on EBAY, in much more colors
than the original stuff, again, I haven't tried it....

Also,what is a Boomwhacker and where could we get one? Sounds like
something my son would love!

Unschooling right this minute....9 yo son is playing Roller Coaster
Tycoon 2 on the computer...while I am checking e-mail and my EBAY
listings....we've only been up an hour or so since he stayed up late
last night playing Roller Coaster Tycoon 2 and still wanted to read
from his Murderous Maths Probability book....

Thanks!
Amy
